docs.snippet: Uruguay's Tupamaro terrorists are trying unfortunately with some success to regain their aura as reasonable reformers and defenders of freedom with their latest offer to ransom the kidnapped American soils expert, Claude L. Fly. Ostensibly, all they...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's Tupamaro terrorists are trying unfortunately with some success to regain their aura as reasonable reformers and defenders of freedom with their latest offer to ransom the kidnapped American soils expert, Claude L. Fly. Ostensibly, all they ask is the chance to put their case against President Pacheco's Government before their countrymen and the world.
docs.abstract: supporting Pacheco refusal to succumb to Tupamaro 'blackmail'

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 10-- Chilean riot policemen, with white clubs swinging from their belts, watched over the central administration building of the University of Chile here today, waiting for about 40 members of a revolutionary leftist militia to...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 10-- Chilean riot policemen, with white clubs swinging from their belts, watched over the central administration building of the University of Chile here today, waiting for about 40 members of a revolutionary leftist militia to leave the gray structure.
docs.abstract: about 40 extremist Revolutionary Left Movement members occupy Univ of Chile bldg, Santiago, following arrest of 13 colleagues for demonstrating in main st of city; incident and earlier arrest of 5 rightwingers accused of bombings mark Govt moves to halt increased activity of extremists of left and right; Allende coalition publicly condemns both left and right; disclaims ties with Revolutionary Left, semi-clandestine group founded by Marxists 6 yrs ago and sharing Uruguayan Tupamaros' views; group's role in establishing squatter camps in Aug noted

headline.main: POLICE CONFRONT LEFTISTS IN CHILE; Extremist Group Occupies Key University Building

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKI Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15 (UPI)--Argentina closed all foreign-exchange markets today and tomorrow to prevent a run on the peso following the resignation of two Cabinet ministers.

headline.main: ARGENTINA SEEKS TO PROTECT PESO; Closes Markets to Avert Run on Her Currency

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 22 The Jordanian representative at the 25th anniversary session of the United Nations accused the United States today of helping and encouraging Israeli occupation of Jordanian territory.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 22 The Jordanian representative at the 25th anniversary session of the United Nations accused the United States today of helping and encouraging Israeli occupation of Jordanian territory.
docs.abstract: Jordanian UN repr el-Farra accuses US of aiding and encouraging Israeli occupation of Jordanian territory, s, UN; says Palestinians deserve right to use force if it becomes impossible to attain just peace through UN but says Jordan still abides by all UN agreements and resolutions; cites feeling of Palestinians that they have been abandoned by internatl community; Arab delegates begin to canvass other delegations in hope of introducing resolution in Gen Assembly urging unconditional resumption of Jarring talks, resolution which would pressure US and Israel, who contend that talks can be resumed only if situation is rectified; positions of US, USSR, UAR and Israel seen so far apart that progress is viewed as unlikely until after Gen Assembly debate; Riad confs with Home; French Min Schumann urges all UN and particularly Security Council members to take stronger hand in world affairs, s

headline.main: Jordan, at U.N., Accuses U.S. of Encouraging Israeli Occupation of Her Territory

byline.original: By HENRY TANNER Special to The New York Times
